title: Letter: COP26 showed business leadership in action
text:
Your broad-brush treatment of corporate leadership on climate change did a disservice to the commendable voluntary efforts this sector is undertaking (“Are corporate 'net zero' plans credible?”, Big Read, November 12).

I am just returning from COP26 where I again saw companies such as Salesforce and Bank of America, both recipients of Prince Charles's Terra Carta Seal, pushing for action on net zero that first reduces emissions wherever possible, and then uses carbon offsets from rigorous, credible projects in forestry and other sectors.

I can testify as a leader in the US forest sector that these and other US companies have been the fiercest advocates for stringent offsets, in many cases setting internal screening and criteria that exceed market rules while pushing for more consistent standards across markets.

As we look for greater climate action it is important that we recognise progress and those models of success that can be replicated.

Jad Daley
President and Chief Executive
American Forests, Washington DC, US
